indykid,"2010-08-02T00:29:35.207Z","Pretty cool Little set","

My mom found this set at Toys 'R' Us while looking for board games and got one for me and one for my dad. Took less than a minute to build.
column2: I only have two poly-bag sets: this and a creator Christmas tree. The only point to this set is to boost your minifig count I guess... It's still pretty cool.

column1:
It's hard to have cons in such a small set. If you can find one get one. It's pretty cool.

",TRUE,5,3,3,3,4

wildwill,"2010-07-26T22:54:29.257Z","At last a way to army build the little green men somewhat cheaply","

I just found these hanging on an end-cap at my local TRU and snatched one up for $3.99.
column2: I would imagine that these won't last very long at retail.

column3: kit and as such doesn't really contain a whole lot of pieces, but the primary model is quite cute and functional. &nbsp
column4: The ship itself is swooshable and the color scheme works rather well, you can definitely tell it's a toy story ship, heck it looks a lot like a mini-version of Buzz's big ship.

column1: The real prize here though is the Alien Mini-Fig, which up until now had only appeared in the expensive Toy Story sets that I couldn't afford, and he is spectacular.
column2: OK I didn't realize that the smaller mini-figs didn't have articulated legs, so I was a bit sad to discover that, but what can you do? &nbsp
column3: The alien head is the best part of the set and I'm sure it would look great on any custom fig.

column1: CONS: VERY small pieces, low piece-count for the price.

rockrage,"2010-07-31T15:50:42.05Z","LGM as LEGO calls them","

I got two of these in the post today.
Uno_Brick,"2010-07-29T23:05:33.6Z","Little Green Aliens","I recently picked up this polybag at a local Toys R Us for $3.99 USD.&nbsp
column2:
It is of course, a great way to obtain more little green aliens, considering just the alien alone is more than $4 on Bricklink. The parts are, what you could call, an added extra.

PROS:
-Little Green Alien minifigure
-""swooshable""

CONS:
-very plain (and rather repetitive) piece variety
-on the expensive side for $4

So, if you've been trying for a way to complete that Pizza Planet claw machine MOC, this set is for you, or if you've been wanting an army of these lime green aliens. Otherwise, a different polybag might be better, such as Buzz's spaceship or Woody's campfire!
",TRUE,2,2,2,2,4

column1:
A_Brickset_user,"2010-09-07T22:13:35.26Z","""oOOOoooooooo...""- Toy Story Aliens","

Strangers! From the Outside! Oooooooo....!
I never thought the day would come that the LGMs would go cheap. This is the only Toy Story Promo so far that is accessible to North American Shoppers. It retails approx $3.99 at ToysRUs.
Building Experience: Not much to expect here. It's a promo.

Parts: This set has a nice assortment of parts, in a nice variety of colors. Greens, reds, and blues really bring out the look and feel of Buzz Lightyear and co. The Little Green Aliens, who were previously available in the Construct-A-Buzz and Zurg sets, are the pilots of these miniships. This is a great way to attain multiple aliens!
Playability: Not much, but a nice swooshable ship. Many younger fans will find this set enjoyable.

Value for Money: For $3.99, this set seems a little more overpriced than most promos, mainly because of TRU's overpricing MSRP policy. It's still a nice way to attain some nicely colored parts and the elusive Green Aliens.

Final Thoughts: This is a set that requires little thought on purchasing or not. It's a great way to introduce yourself to the Toy Story theme or build a MOC of the famous Claw Scene.

",TRUE,3,4,2,3,3

column1:
Odeinoichus,"2011-01-15T11:47:57.283Z","Little Green Man","

Set #30070 Alien Space Ship: This is a polybagged Impulse set from Toy Story and unfortunately there really isn't anything spectacular about it.

Oh sure the model is a nifty looking little space ship to build, and the Mini-Figure is a real gem since this is the cheapest method of getting LGMs from LEGO Toy Story, I was thrilled to finally pick one up, but I just wish it was priced a bit more fairly. There is nothing wrong with this set, it isn't meant to be a WOW type of set, but at 5$ CND it does seem to be a tad on the expensive side for a mere 29 pieces. I was hoping TRU would drop it down to 2.86 like they did last year for the Creator Christmas Tree and Snowman sets that were in abundance, but they didn't, oh well.

It's a great source for LGMs, but other than that you can easily skip this set in your LEGO Toy Story collection if you already have an abundance of them from other sets they are in. The colors of the pieces are good though and dare I say it, but the LGMs would fit in quite nicely with Classic LEGO Space sets, their logo is almost identical to the Classic LEGO Spaceman logo.

",TRUE,3,3,3,3,3
